intro: Perezia recurvata subsp. triceps, commonly known as the three-veined perezia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
